title: Problem 3
content:
(20 points)
Given below are verb forms of the Georgian language (in Roman transcription) and their English translations in arbitrary order:

**Georgian Verb Forms:**
- vtkvi
- kenit
- inadiret
- itavmGdomareve
- vsadilobt
- tkvi
- vigoreb
- vkeni
- nadirob
- visadileb
- vinadire
- ambob
- itavmGdomareve
- izamt
- vivlit

**English Translations:**
- you say
- we dine
- you hunt
- I said
- you (pl.) did
- I did
- you said
- I hunted
- we will walk
- I presided
- I will roll
- I will dine
- you (pl.) hunted
- you presided
- you (pl.) will do

§§. Determine the correct correspondences. If you find more than one solution possible, write the solution you think is more plausible and explain why.

Note. G is a consonant pronounced as the first or the last sound in judge.
Yakov Testelets

---
